node.title: Police called after transgender flags 'desecrated' in Tasmania
node.alt: Pale blue and pale pink striped flags fly outside a heritage sandstone building
node.description: Transgender flags — raised at Hobart's Town Hall to mark a Day of Remembrance — have been vandalised after flying for less than 24 hours, with a local advocate saying the "desecration" was a "reminder of the stigma and hate" faced by the community.
node.content:
["Hobart's Lord Mayor says she is \"appalled\" transgender flags were vandalised and has referred the matter to police.", "The flags went up on Friday, November 19, ahead of a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony on Saturday.", "By Saturday night, they were defaced with what appeared to be paint or ink, and had to be removed.", "Hobart Lord Mayor Anna Reynolds said CCTV had been provided to Tasmania Police.", "\"The raising of the transgender flag on Town Hall during Transgender Awareness Week is one way that we show our support for the Hobart trans and gender-diverse community,\" Ms Reynolds said.", "Equality Tasmania spokeswoman Dana Endelmanis said it was a \"shattering\" incident.", "", "
A spokeswoman for a group opposed to transgender-inclusionary laws said it condemned the defacement of the flags.(Supplied: Matty Wright\u00a0)
", "\"The desecration of our pride flag just a couple of days [since]\u00a0Transgender Day of Remembrance, which we mark every 12 months, is a reminder for us of the stigma and hate that trans and gender-diverse Tasmanians still experience today in our community.", "\"I\u00a0don't think that's Hobart.\u00a0I don't think it's Tasmania,\u00a0but it is a conflict that's happening and we need to pay attention to it,\" she said.", "\"At this year's Transgender Day of Remembrance memorial the transgender community came together and read out the names of the trans and gender-diverse people whose lives have been lost over the past 12 months to violence, fear and hatred across the world.", "\"All we did was speak out the names, the ages and locations of people who have died over the last 12 months and it still took 25 minutes.\"", "Women Speak Tasmania spokeswoman Isla MacGregor \u2014\u00a0whose group does not accept transgender women as women and has campaigned against transgender-inclusionary laws \u2014\u00a0said her group condemned the vandalism.", "\"The people that have very grave concerns about gender ideology in Tasmania, ranging from mental health professionals to lawyers, teachers, parents and family, have all got a very strong focus on appropriate conduct and behaviour.\"", "A group formed in opposition to \"transgender ideology\", the Coalition for Biological Reality, was scheduled to hold a forum at Hobart Town Hall on Saturday.", "The event has been delayed until February because of COVID-19\u00a0restrictions.", "Hobart councillor Jax Fox, who is non-binary, has lobbied against having the forum held in the council-owned building.", "They have worked on new guidelines to prevent similar events being held in Town Hall in future.", "\"It's been really frustrating for me seeing Hobart City Council sign off on such excellent documents on community values \u2026 but [then] say we're still going to let these people who hate you come into this space and say you shouldn't exist, you should de-transition and your identity isn't legitimate.\""]
